conclusion: Analyze the circuit in two states: switch open and closed.
Voltmeter reads 6V when switch S is open.
Resistors 10Ω and 20Ω are in parallel between points a and b.
Calculate equivalent resistance of 10Ω and 20Ω in parallel as 6.67Ω.
Potential difference between a and b is 6V when switch is open.
When switch S is closed, 10Ω resistor is short-circuited.
10Ω resistor disappears from the circuit when switch is closed.
20Ω resistor is directly connected between points a and b when switch is closed.
Potential difference between a and b remains 6V when switch is closed.
Final voltage between points a and b is 6V.
